Introduction.content:
Crispy, golden, spicy beef samosas – loved from the streets of Mumbai to Dar es Salaam, Nairobi, London, Toronto, and Dubai.

This ebook teaches you how to make **restaurant-quality beef samosas at home** that stay crispy for hours, have juicy spiced filling, and disappear in minutes.

Perfect for selling, family gatherings, or just treating yourself. Works worldwide with ingredients you can find in any supermarket or market.

Chapter 1: Ingredients (Makes 30–35 medi.content:
### For the Filling
- 500g (1 lb) ground beef (minced beef) – 15–20% fat is best
- 2 large onions – finely chopped
- 4 cloves garlic – minced
- 1-inch ginger – grated
- 2–3 green chilies – finely chopped (optional)
- 1 cup frozen green peas (optional but recommended)
- 2 tsp salt (adjust to taste)
- 1 tsp black pepper
- 2 tsp ground cumin
- 2 tsp ground coriander
- 1 tsp garam masala
- 1 tsp turmeric powder
- ½ tsp chili powder (or more if you like heat)
- 3 tbsp fresh coriander (cilantro) – chopped
- 3 tbsp cooking oil

### For the Pastry
- 500g (4 cups) all-purpose flour
- 1 tsp salt
- 4 tbsp oil or melted ghee
- 180–200 ml water (adjust as needed)
- Extra flour for rolling

### For Sealing & Frying
- Paste: 2 tbsp flour + 3 tbsp water (glue)
- Oil for deep frying (vegetable, canola, sunflower)

Chapter 2: Step 1 – Make the Perfect Dou.content:
1. Mix flour + salt in a large bowl
2. Add oil/ghee → rub with fingers until it looks like breadcrumbs
3. Gradually add water → knead 8–10 minutes until smooth and soft (not sticky)
4. Cover with damp cloth → rest 30 minutes

Pro tip: The dough should be firm but pliable – like your earlobe when pinched.

https://images.unsplash.com/photo-1599921841143-819065a16493?ixlib=rb-4.0.3&auto=format&fit=crop&w=800&q=80
*Smooth rested samosa dough*

Chapter 3: Step 2 – Cook the Juicy Beef.content:
1. Heat 3 tbsp oil in a large pan
2. Add onions → fry golden brown (8–10 mins)
3. Add garlic + ginger + green chili → fry 1 minute
4. Add minced beef → break it up, cook until no pink remains
5. Add all spices + salt → stir well
6. Cook on medium heat 10–12 minutes until completely dry (no liquid left)
7. Add green peas + fresh coriander → mix and cool completely

Important: Filling MUST be cold and dry before folding – wet filling = soggy samosas!

https://images.unsplash.com/photo-1625944233744-2a44a0058d0b?ixlib=rb-4.0.3&auto=format&fit=crop&w=800&q=80
*Spiced beef filling with peas*

Chapter 4: Step 3 – Fold Like a Pro (Con.content:
1. Divide dough into 15–17 equal balls
2. Roll one ball into oval shape (15 cm / 6 inches)
3. Cut in half → you get 2 semi-circles
4. Take one half → make a cone (wet edge with flour paste)
5. Fill cone with 1–2 tbsp cold filling (don’t overfill!)
6. Seal the top edge tightly with paste → press firmly
7. Repeat until all done

Stand samosas upright on a tray – they should look like perfect triangles.

https://images.unsplash.com/photo-1660837187098-2c9813ed2ea6?ixlib=rb-4.0.3&auto=format&fit=crop&w=800&q=80
*Step-by-step cone folding*

Chapter 5: Step 4 – Fry to Golden Perfec.content:
### Secret to Crispy Samosas That Stay Crispy
- Oil temperature: **Medium-low** (160–170°C / 320–340°F)
- First fry: 8–10 minutes until light golden (don’t brown too much)
- Remove → cool 10 minutes
- Second fry: Increase heat to medium (180°C / 350°F) → fry 3–5 minutes until deep golden and crispy

Double-frying = restaurant-style crunch that lasts 6–8 hours!

Single fry method (for home): Fry on medium heat 12–15 minutes, turning often.

https://images.unsplash.com/photo-1596797038530-2f3729b3c0bf?ixlib=rb-4.0.3&auto=format&fit=crop&w=800&q=80
*Golden crispy beef samosas fresh from the pan*

Chapter 6: Make-Ahead & Storage Tips.content:
- Uncooked folded samosas → freeze up to 3 months (place on tray first, then bag)
- Fry straight from frozen (no thawing) – just add 3–4 extra minutes
- Cooked samosas → reheat in oven/air-fryer 10 mins at 180°C (stays crispy)
- Never microwave – makes them soggy!

Chapter 7: Serving Ideas & Chutneys.content:
### Serve With
- Tamarind chutney
- Mint-coriander chutney
- Chili sauce or ketchup
- Hot chai or cold soda

Perfect for iftar, parties, school snacks, or street-food business!

https://images.unsplash.com/photo-1625944233744-2a44a0058d0b?ixlib=rb-4.0.3&auto=format&fit=crop&w=800&q=80
*Plate of beef samosas with chutney*

Chapter 8: Troubleshooting Guide.content:
- Samosas burst while frying → filling too wet or overfilled
- Soft instead of crispy → oil too hot or single fry only
- Dough tears → didn’t rest enough or too dry
- Bland taste → under-seasoned filling (taste before folding!)
- Oily samosas → oil temperature too low

Conclusion.content:
You now have the exact recipe used by the best samosa sellers worldwide.

Make a batch this weekend – your family and friends will be amazed!

Sell them at 0.50–1 USD each → huge profit and happy customers.

Happy cooking – the world loves a good samosa!
